input: Bob is big. Bob is furry. Bob is green. Bob is rough. Bob is white. Charlie is not blue. Erin is furry. Erin is green. Erin is white. Erin is young. Gary is big. If someone is white then they are rough. If Erin is young and Erin is blue then Erin is green. All young people are furry. White, green people are furry. If someone is green then they are big. If someone is big then they are white. Furry, big people are blue. If someone is rough then they are blue. Blue people are young. Question: Gary is furry.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Bob : obj
constant Charlie : obj
constant Erin : obj
constant Gary : obj

constant Big : obj → Prop
constant Furry : obj → Prop
constant Green : obj → Prop
constant Rough : obj → Prop
constant White : obj → Prop
constant Blue : obj → Prop
constant Young : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Big Bob
axiom T2 : Furry Bob
axiom T3 : Green Bob
axiom T4 : Rough Bob
axiom T5 : White Bob
axiom T6 : ¬ Blue Charlie
axiom T7 : Furry Erin
axiom T8 : Green Erin
axiom T9 : White Erin
axiom T10 : Young Erin
axiom T11 : Big Gary

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, White x → Rough x
axiom R2 : Young Erin ∧ Blue Erin → Green Erin
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Young x → Furry x
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, White x ∧ Green x → Furry x
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Green x → Big x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Big x → White x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Furry x ∧ Big x → Blue x
axiom R8 : ∀ x : obj, Rough x → Blue x
axiom R9 : ∀ x : obj, Blue x → Young x

theorem gary_is_furry : Furry Gary :=
begin
  apply R4,
  split,
  apply R6,
  exact T11,
  apply R5,
  apply R8,
  apply R1,
  apply R6,
  exact T11,
end

-- The answer is True
